page.title: 03Councillor's report Salford
page.content: Mr Pennington became a local Labour Councillor because he wanted to serve the people and felt that only the Labour Party could create an equal and just society. Councillors are responsible for making decisions about how much money should be spent on providing local services. For example last year Â£56m was spent on education. Due to government cutbacks there is not enough money in the kitty and so the building of a sports and recreation centre next to our school will have to be postponed yet again. The redevelopment of Little Hulton as a Salford overspill estate has not been without its problems but has generally been a great success providing many new homes.Little Hulton faces 3 major problems: unemployment, vandalism and drug abuse.
